definition: to obey/to follow/to arrange/to make reasonable/along/favorable

sentences.english: The turning direction of this water turbine is overlook clockwise.
sentences.chinese: 水轮机旋向为俯视顺时针。

sentences.english: Then you see the chakra spinning open clockwise down into the earth.
sentences.chinese: 然后你看着脉轮顺时针旋转打开，放大至大地。

sentences.english: Then I go clockwise along the inside curve, then back along the slit.
sentences.chinese: 再顺时针沿着里面的曲线走，又回到这个裂口。

sentences.english: The inner boundary either goes clockwise, or you put a minus sign.
sentences.chinese: 内部边界曲线是顺时针的，或者加一个负号。

sentences.english: Flights over Moscow are made only in the clockwise direction.
sentences.chinese: 在莫斯科上空飞行只能是沿着顺时针方向。

sentences.english: It looks like the dial only turns clockwise in either 3 or 4 increments.
sentences.chinese: 看起来这个转盘只能按顺时针方向转3到4格。

sentences.english: Facing the satellite, clockwise polarisation is positive, negative is anticlockwise .
sentences.chinese: 面对卫星，顺时针极化是正面，阴性反时针。

sentences.english: Turn the knob clockwise to switch the TV set on.
sentences.chinese: 将旋钮按顺时针方向转，打开电视机。

sentences.english: This guy is walking clockwise on C.
sentences.chinese: 这个人现在是顺时针沿着C走的。

sentences.english: The conveyor system moves the tubes clockwise towards the cleaning and filling station.
sentences.chinese: 传送带系统以顺时针方向将管筒移动到清洁和填装站。

sentences.english: For slower rebound, turn the red adjuster knob clockwise.
sentences.chinese: 顺时针转动红色调节钮以减慢回弹速度。

sentences.english: Li Mingchu chose to pass it clockwise.
sentences.chinese: 李明决定把绳子顺时针传下去。

sentences.english: Begin swinging the hoop clockwise so the hoop is parallel to the ground.
sentences.chinese: 开始顺时针摆动呼啦圈，让它与地面平行。

sentences.english: Its function is to achieve the right image clockwise and counter-clockwise rotation.
sentences.chinese: 其功能是实现对图象的顺时针和逆时针旋转。

sentences.english: That's because of a clockwise current of water called the Antarctic circumpolar current.
sentences.chinese: 这是由于被称为南极绕极环流的顺时针环流造成的。

sentences.english: In addition, observers who initially perceived a clockwise rotation had more difficulty experiencing the alternative.
sentences.chinese: 并且，最先看到了顺时针转的人转换起来更加困难。

definition: to rotate (about an axis)/to revolve/to turn/to move in a circle/to gyrate
to rotate about an axis/axis of rotation (math.)
along/to follow (a line, tradition etc)/to carry on/to trim (a border with braid, tape etc)/border/edge
